title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Thursday 28 September 2017 - BBC News
summary: masked attacker stabs boy , 14 , in truro .
woolacombe asian hornets ' nest destroyed , but another sighting reported in plymouth .
plans for new town councils in torbay are rejected .
investigations continue into fatal capsizing of fishing vessel the solstice .
new hard-hitting film for teenagers about to start driving lessons .

documents.title: our live coverage
text: that 's all from bbc local live in devon and cornwall for today , but we 'll be back at 08:00 to bring you all friday 's news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't miss spotlight with justin leigh and natalie cornah at 18:30 on bbc one , and the late news at 22:30 tonight .
author: Amy Gladwell
BBC News Online

documents.title: poem sheds light on devon word 'dimpsy '
text: ever heard the word dimpsy being spoken ?
it is actually a devon word and it means twilight .
so we asked local poet chrissy williams to read her poem dimpsy to mark national poetry day .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather : rain spreading before sunshine and showers on friday
text: clouding over this evening with rain spreading east across all parts before midnight , and with some heavy bursts of rain at times during the early hours .
some strong winds along the coasts .
minimum temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .
friday morning will be wet and windy with some heavy bursts of rain first thing .
drier and brighter weather will quickly spread in from the west , with the afternoon being a mix of bright sunshine and isolated showers .
maximum temperature : 18c ( 64f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: football : truro aim to continue on winning 'buzz '
text: in-form truro city have their sights on a new club record by reaching the final qualifying round of the fa cup .
the national league south leaders face afc sudbury on saturday and are only two games away from a place in the first-round draw .
they have won their last seven games in a row and looking to make it eight .
`` the club has a big buzz around it now and people are starting to see what we 're about , '' goalkeeper tom mchale ( told bbc radio cornwall .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: 'famous golf holes ' come to cornwall
text: have you ever fancied playing some of golf 's most iconic holes - on courses such as st andrew 's or augusta ?
well now you can - without leaving the south west .
the famous nine course at gwel an mor , near portreath , has copied famous holes .
a dream job for @ twitterid @ twitterid at the new 'famous nine ' # golf course at @ twitterid with bernard gallacher
author: Hamish Marshall
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: truro stabbing : arrested boy 'released under investigation '
text: a 16-year-old boy arrested following a stabbing in truro has been `` released under investigation '' , devon and cornwall police say .
emergency services were called to the trelander estate on wednesday evening to reports that a 14-year-old boy was stabbed .
police said the incident took place outside the trelander and st clement community hall .
the victim 's injuries were described as a puncture wound to the back which was serious but not life-threatening .
police said their enquiries were continuing and the victim remained in hospital in a stable condition .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: man beat partner and waved knife in supermarket car park
text: a man continuously kicked and punched his girlfriend in a supermarket car park and then pulled a lock knife on members of the public who tried to intervene because he had `` had enough '' and she had `` been doing it all day '' , a court heard .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: woolacombe hornet nest destroyed , but sighting in plymouth
text: a nest of asian hornets has been found and destroyed in north devon , and a `` search and destroy '' mission is now under way to find more in the area .
bee experts used heat-seeking cameras to find the nest in woolacombe in a bid to stop the invasive species breeding and spreading .
experts are investigating reports of a sighting of one of the insects in plymouth .
author: John Henderson
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: friends ' grief over homeless hit-and-run victim , 27
text: a young homeless man killed in a suspected hit-and-run in dartmouth was a `` lovely man '' who had turned his life around , say friends .
jamie symons , 27 , died after being hit by a car on college way in the town early on wednesday .
police have launched a murder investigation and have appealed for witnesses .
kath friedrich , of charity people assisting torbay 's homeless , said he had started working with animals `` which he loved '' on a local farm .
mr symons and his beloved collie dog , kauli , were well-known in the torbay area , she added .
she said : `` it 's a massive loss because he was a lot more settled and working with animals .
the only consolation is that he had been able to achieve his dream . ''
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: royal cornwall hospital gets £ 1m for emergency department
text: the royal cornwall hospital is facing a tough winter , according to one senior manager .
but staff are hoping a £ 1m investment in the truro hospital 's emergency department ( ed ) will help to make it run more smoothly .

the royal cornwall hospitals trust held its annual general meeting this morning , in a week when pressures on the ed again prompted patients to be asked to choose alternatives unless it was a real health emergency .
trust chief operating officer rab mcewan said the public had a part to play in helping the ed this winter .
he said : `` it 's supposed to be a life-and-limb-threatening condirtion that you attend the emergency department with .
`` we 've got fantastic minor injuries units around the county , great gps , and the 111 service is a great way for people to keep themselves healthy and at home . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: race against time to track asian hornets in north devon
text: bee experts are using heat-seeking cameras to find a suspected nest of asian hornets in north devon in a race against time before the invasive species breeds and spreads .
it comes as the national bee unit confirmed a sighting of the creature - which kills and eats honeybees - at an apiary near woolacombe .
the asian hornet is smaller than our native hornet and poses no greater risk to human health than a bee .
however , ecologists have warned of dire consequences for honeybees , and the honey industry , if the hornet is not swiftly eliminated .
the sighting in devon is the first confirmed in the uk since last year , when a nest was discovered in the tetbury area of gloucestershire .
bee inspectors tracked down and destroyed that nest .
author: John Henderson
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: car crashes into wall outside plymouth primary school
text: a car has crashed into a wall on a busy plymouth road .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: rugby : chiefs ' players 'driving each other on '
text: exeter chiefs head coach ali hepher believes their strength in depth will stand them in good stead as they try to retain their premiership title .
the chiefs head the table with three wins out of four so far , including a 31-17 victory over wasps last weekend .
`` we want a competitive squad so each and every one of them drives each other on , '' hepher told bbc radio devon .
`` it means you have n't got people resting in the first team knowing they 're going to get next week . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: council grass cutter punched workmate in shed row
text: a council grass cutter attacked a workmate and left him needing 16 stitches in an argument about the use of a groundsman 's shed , a court heard .

paul white , 50 , got out of his van at belle isle park in exeter and knocked victim peter haynes to the ground before standing over him and repeatedly punching him in the face , exeter crown court was told .
the attack followed tensions between the grass cutters and other grounds staff who complained that their van blocked the entrance to the shed at the riverside park .
white , of holloway street , exeter , admitted causing grievous bodily harm and was jailed for eight months , suspended for a year .
he was also ordered to pay £ 1,000 compensation and do 120 hours unpaid work .
he has since lost his job at the city council .
author: Amy Gladwell
BBC News Online

documents.title: wildlife trust and utility firm check river pesticide level
text: the chemcatchers are sampling tools which are used as part of work to monitor pesticide levels .
after they are left in water for a while , they are taken out and analysed in laboratories .
we 've been working with @ twitterid putting 'chem-catchers ' in the river exe to monitor pesticide levels .
part of # upstreamthinking

documents.title: plans for 130 homes at penhale army camp approved
text: planning permission has been granted to build 132 new houses at the former penhale army camp near perranporth .

the plans include clearance of the existing ministry of defence buildings and changing the use of an existing farmhouse into two homes , four 75 sq-m commercial buildings with landscaping , open space and parking .
it was approved by cornwall council with 10 votes in favour , two against and no abstentions .
author: Amy Gladwell
BBC News Online

documents.title: your childhood toys and gadgets are now in a devon museum
text: you know you 're getting old when the toys and gadgets you played with as a child find their way into a museum .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: torbay hospital 'under major pressure '
text: torbay hospital says it 's under major pressure with higher than usual emergency department attendances , and large numbers of acutely ill patients .
since sunday , the hospital has been on a special programme , previously known as a red alert , to try and manage the situation and keep patients safe .
it 's on what 's called operation pressures escalation level 3 - opel 3 - which means the local health and care system is experiencing major pressures and external support may be required .
author: Sophie Pierce
BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: bigbury surf school 'devastated ' after boards stolen
text: nine stand-up paddle boards were stolen from a surf school 's van in bigbury last night .
discovery surf school said it was `` devastated '' at the robbery , which is thought to have happened at about 19:30 , `` not long after we locked up following lessons '' .
the red paddle ride boards have a distinctive appearance , and kingsbridge police have asked anyone with information about the boards to get in touch .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: truro teen stabbing : community leaders 'very shocked '
text: community leaders in truro say they are `` very , very shocked '' at the stabbing of a teenager in the city .
emergency services , including armed police officers , were called to the trelander estate in truro at 19:40 on wednesday to reports that a 14-year-old boy was stabbed .
the victim 's injuries were described as a puncture wound to the back which was serious but not life-threatening .
he was taken to the royal cornwall hospital where his condition is said to be stable .
police said the incident took place outside the trelander and st clement community hall , which remains closed .
community leaders said a youth club was meeting last night and some of the youngsters may have witnessed what happened , and they were concerned for those young people .
they also said an adult volunteer at the club gave first aid to the victim before paramedics arrived .
a 16-year-old boy was arrested and remained in custody , devon and cornwall police said .
author: David George
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: solstice capsize investigators 'in plymouth for some days '
text: investigators say they are expected to be in plymouth for some days after a fishing boat failed to return home , leaving one man dead .
the investigation is looking into what caused fishing vessel the solstice to capsize off plymouth .
the body of one of the crew was found yesterday afternoon .
skipper nick jones and chris wonnacott were rescued after they were found clinging to the hull in the early hours of wednesday .
author: Simon Clemison
BBC Spotlight

documents.title: bereaved parents warn teen drivers
text: parents in the south west who 've lost their children in car crashes are making an emotional plea to young people who are about to learn to drive .
students in cornwall are being shown a hard-hitting film as part of the initiative .
they 've also been hearing from pete atkinson , whose son died when he tried to drive home after a night out with friends .
he said he urged other youngsters to be careful .
tom atkinson ( was just 19 when his car crashed near tavistock a few years ago .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: historic lifeboat back after almost 50-year absence
text: an historic tyneside lifeboat , the bedford , has returned back home to south shields - via devon - thanks to local businesses .

originally stationed at the coble landing in south shields , the 131-year-old 10m-long boat left the town in 1968 when a home was found for her at the maritime museum in exeter , which closed in 1997 .

now she is back in the north east after businesses - including the port of tyne , bt south tyneside , colman 's and j barbour and sons - clubbed together to buy her back and transport her back to tyneside .
until recently , the bedford was part of a collection at the eyemouth maritime centre in scotland , which closed and its contents put up for auction .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: teenage boy stabbed in the back on trelander highway estate in truro has emergency surgery
text: a teenage boy is stable in hospital after undergoing emergency surgery following an attack in which he was stabbed in the back .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: missing baby barn owl : do not approach warning
text: a young barn owl is still missing from a wildlife park in cornwall .
managers at feadon farm wildlife centre at portreath say errol disappeared on tuesday while they were training him .
they have asked anyone who sees him not to approach him but to contact bbc radio cornwall .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: going supersonic : is this the best work experience ever ?
text: student murray wells spent his university summer break helping out on one of the most exciting projects in british engineering .
the bloodhound ssc project is building a supersonic car at its avonmouth workshop in a bid to break the land speed record and reach 1,000mph .
the 21-year-old from long itchington , warwickshire , is now back at the university of hertfordshire while the car is in newquay , cornwall , for a month of testing .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: football : torquay hope loanee lee will return in october
text: torquay united hope loan signing jordan lee will return to the club in october after suffering chest pains .
twenty-year-old full-back lee played two games at the start of the season after returning from bournemouth for a second spell .
`` he is now going to be training with bournemouth for another couple of weeks to run through further testing .
`` this is purely as a precaution .
his return to tufc is now expected to take place on 9 october , '' said a statement on the torquay website .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: ferry fire alert in falmouth caused by 'welding fumes '
text: fire crews have investigated a suspected fire on board the condor clipper , which is moored in falmouth docks this morning .
a spokesman from cornwall fire and rescue service said they found there had been no fire and the alarm was raised due to `` welding fumes '' .
author: Rob England
BBC News Online

documents.title: family 's flat is so infested with mice they moved to a travelodge
text: residents living in a block of flats are being blighted by an infestation of mice - forcing one mum and her infant daughter to move into a travelodge .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: ferry fire at falmouth docks
text: firefighters have been sent to falmouth docks to reports of a fire onboard a ferry .
crews from the town and from truro were sent to the commodore clipper ferry , cornwall fire and rescue service said .
the vessel is one of the condor ferries fleet , which operates between the channel islands , france and southern england .
it is believed to be in falmouth for maintenance .
the fire is believed to be out and fire crews were working with the ship 's staff to confirm it had not spread , the fire service said .
author: Amy Gladwell
BBC News Online

documents.title: weekend engineering to hit south western railway trains
text: the operator 's routes to exeter are among those which could be affected during repairs in the woking area .
# engineeringswr engineering taking place across our network 30 sept and 1 october .
please check your journey

documents.title: cornwall travel : accident on a3047 redruth
text: in redruth , the a3047 partially blocked around cardrew way due to an accident .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: investigations continue into boat tragedy
text: a marine accident investigation is continuing into what caused the fishing vessel the solstice to capsize off plymouth .
the body of one of the crew was found yesterday afternoon .
skipper nick jones and chris wonnacott were rescued after they were found clinging to the hull .
superintendent keith dixon , from the fisherman 's mission in newlyn , said the incident was a reminder of how dangerous the industry can be .
he said : `` you do what you can , you 've got to look after yourself .
you 've got to be responsible for your own safety .
dangerous job and that 's that . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: video : dam builders still beavering away
text: night-cam footage has been captured of beavers building a dam in cornwall in the past week .

it 's part of what organisers describe as a `` groundbreaking '' project to bring the animals back to the county after being hunted to extinction in the uk 400 years ago , cornwall wildlife trust says .
check out this incredible footage from @ twitterid of our cornwall beaver project pair building a dam at night .
hello , please could we use this on the bbc with a credit ?
hi amy , yes thats fine as long as you credit both cwt and @ twitterid thanks !
ok no problem - thanks
do they compete with otters ?
no since beavers are herbivores .
they actually benefit otters since their damming creates new fishing pools and more wetland habitat !
ok ill have a couple on my section of the stream how deep do the need it ? ? !
wow great work !
you should be proud of your achievements and keep up your awesome work !
# patontheback
i like this animal , this creature is so awesome
@ twitterid
great news
really excited that the trail cameras were able record this footage .
they are in full swing .
exciting .
for god 's sake do n't tell where this is - some 'countryside conservationist ' will be out there with their gun and gas canister tonight
author: Twitter

documents.title: fire at lanhydrock cafe
text: a fire has broken out at the cafe in the car park at lanhydrock , near bodmin .

a dishwasher was reported to be on fire at about 08:30 and a fire engine was dispatched from bodmin , but staff at the national trust property had put the fire out by the time it arrived , cornwall fire and rescue service said .
author: Amy Gladwell
BBC News Online

documents.title: firearms police and dog unit involved in stabbing arrest
text: firearms officers and a dog unit were involved in a police operation after a teenager was stabbed in the back in truro , police say .
the 14-year-old , from penzance , was attacked outside trelander and st clement community hall at about 19:40 on wednesday .
he was left in a `` serious but not life-threatening condition '' , police said .
devon and cornwall police said : `` local units , firearms officers and a dog unit attended the scene .
`` police enquiries led to an address in truro where a 16-year-old boy was arrested on sus of assault causing grievous bodily harm . ''
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: bosses reveal when broken torpoint ferry will be fixed
text: torpoint ferry chiefs have announced the third ferry will remain out of action `` until at least thursday afternoon '' , but have asked customers to be patient - and polite .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: warning of long a & e waits ahead
text: there 's a warning of longer waiting times at the royal cornwall hospital 's emergency department this winter due to the issue of so-called bed blocking .
hospital managers said many patients were unable to be discharged because there 's no adequate care available or in place for them after they left .
they have already appealed to people to stay away from a & e departments unless it is a life-threatening situation .

health campaigner graham webster said : `` we 've come out of one of the most difficult winters that we 've ever known , and , unless we do something quickly , we 're going to have an even worse winter going into this winter now '' .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: travel news for devon : accident and delays in exeter
text: travel news for devon : accident and delays in exeter
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: travel news for cornwall : three accidents in the west
text: travel news for cornwall : three accidents in the west
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: capsized fishing boat investigation continues
text: an investigation is continuing into what caused the fishing boat solstice to capsize off plymouth .
two men were rescued after they were found clinging on to the hull of the vessel on wednesday morning .
a third man died as a result of the incident .
a search and rescue operation near the eddystone lighthouse involved two royal navy warships , a border force vessel and three rnli lifeboats , along with two coastguard helicopters .
the marine accident investigation branch said it was piecing together why the boat got into difficulty .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: masked attacker stabs boy , 14 , in truro
text: a 14-year-old boy has been stabbed by a masked attacker in truro , police say .
officers said the boy , from penzance , was talking with a friend outside trelander and st clement community hall when he was the victim of an unprovoked attack at about 19:40 on wednesday .
he received a puncture wound to his back and was described as in a `` serious but not life-threatening condition '' .
a 16-year-old boy was arrested on sus of assault causing grievous bodily harm .
author: Amy Gladwell
BBC News Online

documents.title: driver reported missing after taking 208-mile detour across devon
text: an elderly driver who was trying to take a short trip from camborne in cornwall was reported missing when they took a wrong turn and ended up crossing devon , somerset and being stopped by police in gloucester .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: travel for cornwall : slow traffic in st austell and near penryn
text: travel for cornwall : slow traffic in st austell and near penryn
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: weather : mist and fog patches will clear
text: it will be dry and bright after early mist and fog patches clear .
we 'll have full forecast later .
weather 's not looking too bad today # cornwall # devon # somerset # dorset # jersey # guernsey
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: torbay council rejects plans for new town authorities
text: plans to set up new town councils in torbay as a way of tackling the unitary authority 's financial problems have been rejected by councillors at a meeting .
the idea was to create them in torquay and paignton so they could charge taxes to pay for things such as public toilets and libraries .
but councillors voted instead last night to look at other ways of raising money , including holding a referendum on raising council tax by more than 2 % .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for thursday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .
if you want to get in touch , please email us .
